description: {"blocks":[{"key":"a01qi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7bfh","text":"This protocol outlines the NanoString GeoMx Digital Spatial Profiler Whole Transcriptome Atlas (DSP WTA) assay that was applied in the Human Tumor Atlas Network (HTAN) Tissue MicroArrary (TMA) -TransNetwork Project (TNP).\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b97ah","text":"The TMA-TNP evaluates various characterization and analytics methodologies on a large array of breast tumor samples representing a broad spectrum of disease state and subtype. A commercially available anonymized breast tumor TMA was purchased and serial sections were distributed.  Participating HTAN Centers characterized the FFPE specimens using various imaging platforms and generated a spatially resolved cell type/state census using each center’s method of choice. Data was recorded in a common repository to enable joint analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3p648","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"frn60","text":"The protocol that immediately precedes this one for TMA-TNP Phase 4  can be found at:  dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.ewov1o7wolr2/v1. It describes FFPE block serial sectioning, slide processing and TMA sample distribution. Two compartments (Tumor and Stroma) in each TMA core were analyzed to determine cell-to-cell interactions in the tissues.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":87,"length":48}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"042166E90BCE11EF85000A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.ewov1o7wolr2/v1"}}}}

fork_info.title: NanoString GeoMx DSP TMA-TNP protein assay

Avoid the formation of air bubbles on the tissue","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"405ug","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8slbk","text":"Wash the slides with PBS for   (1 time) and proceed to the next step immediately","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":29,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"8C871DF0E2C611ECB575CF7E456F6586","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"97t08","text":"place the slides in a coplin jar and expose RNA targets with Proteinase K at   for   at   in waterbath","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":77,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":83,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":88,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fe9rr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"99q49","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"0.1","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"0.1 microgram/mL, default condition","scientificNotation":false,"unit":31}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6tc87","text":"(Optional) QC passed samples are processed with Biological probe QC (only applying to CTA)  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c5q8n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a2ps0","text":"Open an analysis file and perform the QC  with default parameters except Negative control (4 or lesser), No template PCR control (NTC count,  1,000-10,000) and minimum nuclei counts (50-100)  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":38,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"62q17","text":"Determine the New Analysis file name and save it  in the designated folder.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9rb4b","text":"Select and queue the slides to analyze  using \"New Analysis\"  in the DSP server.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":45,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7vro1","text":"QC DSP data and normalization","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"di0ba","text":"ROI selection and AOI segmentation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7jq91","text":"After scanning is done, each color channel intensity is adjusted to show visualization markers along with tissue or cell line property","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ep45u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7rbf4","text":"Each ROI is determined and selected by pathologist's guide, and drawn with circle (maximum 660um radius), rectangle (maximum 660x785um) or polygonal shape (maximum 660x785um). Due to the limitation of scan area in the slide loading slot, two same TMA slides were used to   cover half of 88 cores in each slide (88 cores were embedded and slightly shifted to either left or right side of slide)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"uspl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5rv6f","text":"In the segment menu, 2 segmentation classes (Tumor, stromal and others) are added and  parameters are set in the following order:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4u6c8","text":"\nFor Tumor segmentation (Segment 1), Alexa 532 (PanCK) is set to positive (\"+\") and the others set to ignore (\"0\") for the tumor collection","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2dc47","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6sbcs","text":"For stromal segmentation (Segment 2), Alexa 532 (PanCK), Alexa 594 (CD45) and FITC 525 (SYTO 13) were set to ignore (\"0\") to collect all other regions  \n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"482a5","text":"Then click Generate Segments.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":11,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9m98n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8ao7j","text":"Once all segments are automatically generated, each channel parameter needs to be manually re-adjusted with pathologist's input to confirm if the segmentation is correctly done.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"585db","text":"Caution: less than 20 cells in each segment is removed from collection due to threshold for low signal. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8msbv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"80tmg","text":"Once all AOI segmentation is complete, Exit Scan Workspace button icon is clicked to approve ROI selection and samples are collected in 96-well plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"29b4a","text":"Sample sequencing ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7bttc","text":"The sample collection plates were completely dried out at   for   and shipped to the genomics core at Dana Faber Cancer Institute for NGS library preparation and sample sequencing","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":58,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":64,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"27t2e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fhdk9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"65","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cfepc","text":"FASTQ raw sequencing files were generated and converted to DCC (Digital Count Conversion) files which can be imported to DSP for the analysis","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2qke4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2isd8","text":"QC data were filtered with low expression across all segments. Choose 5-10% of segments frequency or higher of Limit of Quantification (LoQ) or both. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ahet8","text":"Upper Quartile (Q3) normalization from all target were performed after filtering out low expression targets (Q3 normalization method is recommended since larger number of targets may increase the noise of geomean normalized data) and data was exported in csv format","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
